intro: Lepidaploa leptoclada, commonly known as the slender leafed daisies, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is known for its delicate, hairy leaves. It has a low-growing habit and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
